comments:
The following message is shown in the log file if an administrator installs eclipse, but a normal user is running eclipse.  After this message and several others that are caused because of this failure, Eclipse fails to start.

!SESSION 2006-04-28 12:42:37.561 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20050627-1435
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2006-04-28 12:42:37.920
!MESSAGE Error reading configuration: <snip>\eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.osgi\.manager\.fileTableLock (Access is denied)
!STACK 0
java.io.FileNotFoundException: <snip>\eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.osgi\.manager\.fileTableLock (Access is denied)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:177)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.Locker_JavaNio.lock(Locker_JavaNio.java:34)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.FileManager.lock(FileManager.java:361)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.FileManager.open(FileManager.java:658)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseAdaptor.initFileManager(EclipseAdaptor.java:818)
...<snip>

I've seen a couple of other bug reports 

69782  Has been marked as fixed in 3.0 which looks like an exact match for this problem, but it doesn't appear to be fixed or it has been rebroken in 3.1.1.

44735 Also appears to be similar although I'm not sure if its the same bug.  This one has been marked as wont fix.

I've seen workarounds for using a different -data directory or using 
"-vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none"  in the startup parameters.
IThis setup requires special care. Please see the eclipse help.
